alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County; Quay County; Roosevelt County; South Central Highlands; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 23 at 8:32AM MST until January 24 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations generally between 3 and 6 inches with higher amounts of 6 to 9 inches expected in eastern Lincoln county and southwestern Guadalupe county. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central Highlands, Eastern Lincoln County, South Central Highlands, Curry County, De Baca County, Guadalupe County, Quay County, Roosevelt County, and Southwest Chaves County. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to Noon MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult with near-zero visibility at times. Road closures are possible. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40, U.S. 285, U.S 54, and U.S. 60. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County; Quay County; Roosevelt County; South Central Highlands; Southwest Chaves County
